questions.text: My spiritual reserves in difficult times are ...

answers.4: usually sufficient — I can weather most storms
answers.5: deep — I have substantial reserves built up over time
answers.2: thin — barely enough to get through
answers.3: variable — sometimes I have reserves, sometimes not
answers.1: empty — I have nothing to draw on

questions.text: Spiritual insights and wisdom I can share with others are ...

answers.4: substantial — I have real wisdom to offer in many areas
answers.5: abundant — years of accumulated insight ready to deploy
answers.2: minimal — I have little to offer others
answers.3: developing — I have some insights in some areas
answers.1: nonexistent — I'm still just trying to figure things out myself

answers.4: more than I consume most of the time
answers.5: abundance — I have plenty to give away
answers.3: enough to maintain, with occasional surplus
answers.1: nothing — I'm constantly running on fumes

questions.text: What I have to offer others seeking God is ...

answers.4: substantial — I have a real relationship to draw from
answers.5: deep — years of walking with God that I can share
answers.2: very little — my own relationship is too shallow
answers.3: something — I can help in limited ways

questions.text: My prayer life, Scripture knowledge, and spiritual practices have accumulated into ...

answers.4: a solid resource — I have real capital to deploy
answers.5: a deep well — substantial reserves ready to draw from
answers.3: a moderate base — helpful but not robust
answers.1: almost nothing — I haven't built much
